committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Administration of Justice

official_title: To amend title 28, United States Code, to provide for the selection of grand and petit jurors for each United States district court from sources other than the voter registration lists or the lists of actual voters of the political subdivisions within the district or division, and for other purposes.
short_title: Jury Selection and Voter Participation Act of 1989

summary.text: Jury Selection and Voter Participation Act of 1989 - Amends the Federal judicial code to require that each U.S. district court plan for the selection of grand and petit jurors prescribe the sources of names of such prospective jurors. States that such source may not be limited to voter registration lists or lists of actual voters, but may include social security records and Federal income tax returns. Modifies the Social Security Act and the Internal Revenue Code accordingly. Prohibits a State from drawing the names of prospective jurors exclusively from voter registration lists or lists of actual voters. Requires such State to use other sources such as motor vehicle license and registration records, lists of utility customers, and State or local income tax returns.

titles.title: Jury Selection and Voter Participation Act of 1989

To amend title 28, United States Code, to provide for the selection of grand and petit jurors for each United States district court from sources other than the voter registration lists or the lists of actual voters of the political subdivisions within the district or division, and for other purposes.
